= '''HIRLAM On-Duty Task Team''' =

On-Duty Team is a HIRLAM-B instrument to carry through regular support, maintenance and monitoring duties on a rotating basis. Staff on duty typically dedicate one week of his/her time once or twice per year to perform duties on the following three categories:

 * [wiki:OnDuty/Helpdesk HIRLAM Helpdesk]: General support mainly related to inquiries on general issues.
 * [wiki:OnDuty/Monitoring Monitoring the HIRLAM data portal]:  Instructions on monitoring of the joint HIRLAM/HARMONIE model intercomparison data portal.
 * [wiki:OnDuty/MonitoringGLAMEPS Monitoring GLAMEPS]: Instructions on the daily monitoring about delivery and performance with the HIRLAM/ALADIN probablistic forecast GLAMEPS at production phase. 

Staff with different expertise are encouraged to sign up for this task, and contribute each on his/her way the mission with special focus in view of their own expertise. It is estimated that going through daily on-duty tasks as proposed in those instructions will typically not take more than one or two hours, and it is further stressed here that, while on-duty staff are expected to handle various support issues (as some sort of HIRLAM-calldesk) and to do daily monitoring according to specifications,  he or she in most cases is not supposed to trouble-shoot reported or detected problems. The essential point here is to offer a point of contact on questions, and a watchful eye on monitoring products.

= '''Who are in the team''' =

All HIRLAM research staffs are welcome and encounraged to participate. The team will benefit from different expertise/knowledge about various components of the HIRLAM/HARMONIE system, including those about system aspects, data assimilation and observation data handling, forecast model, post-processing, evaluation and diagnosis about both deterministic and probablistic forecasts, etc. 

The On-duty team is coordinated by HIRLAM project leader on system aspects, Ulf Andrae (ulf.andrae@smhi.se) and project leader on quality assurance and operational cooperation, Xiaohua Yang (xiaohua@dmi.dk). Daily activities can normally be followed in the HIRLAM fora, such as
 * [http://www.hirlam.org/index.php?option=com_kunena&Itemid=160&func=listcat&catid=1 Helpdesk]
 * [http://www.hirlam.org/index.php?option=com_kunena&Itemid=160&func=showcat&catid=15 Operational GLAMEPS]
 * [http://www.hirlam.org/index.php?option=com_kunena&Itemid=160&func=showcat&catid=6 General monitoring matters] 

Interested to contribute? Fill your own name on the blank spot and drop an email to the coordinators! Your activity on the on-duty team are counted as your services contribution to the HIRLAM-B programme.
